title: curriculum vitae
content:
### Education

* **2014–2019** – *Bachelor in Visual Arts*, Escola de Belas Artes, Universidade Federal do Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2015** – Exchange program in *Bildende Kunst*, Universität der Künste Berlin (UdK), Germany  
* **2020–2024** – *Master in Digital Media*, Hochschule für Künste Bremen, Germany  

### Exhibitions / Residencies

* **2013** – Interactive sound installation *Simbinoise* as part of the *Biônicos collective*, at the festival *Circo Digital*, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2016** – Generative video installation *Recombining Memories*, Lampa Gallery, *The Wrong Biennale*, Saint Petersburg, Russia  
* **2016** – Interactive video installation *XYZ*, exhibition *Capte-me*, Museum of Tomorrow, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2016** – *Estudo sobre Uruçumirim*, intervention with print and Portuguese stones, exhibition *Intervenções entre XIX e XXI*, Museu Nacional de Belas-Artes, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2017** – *Itinerário Etimológico*, sound installation, exhibition *Histórias fora de Ordem*, National Historic Museum, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2017** – *When Speaking of Tongues*, collaboration with Lotus Lien, Cooper Union senior art student exhibition, New York City, USA  
* **2018** – *Vozes da Terra*, residency program *Arte Eletrônica Indígena*, Museum of Modern Art (MAM), Salvador, Brazil  
* **2018** – Co-curator and exhibiting artist, *Generative Art Festival Multiverso*, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2019** – *Vozes da Terra*, *British Academy Summer Showcase*, London, UK  
* **2021** – *The living body is the central object of all politics*, with Chi Him Chik, Hochschule für Künste Bremen & Gutebahnhof, Bremen, Germany  
* **2022** – *Future pass archaeology of now*, exhibition *Learning to draw*, Hochschule für Künste Bremen, Germany  
* **2022** – *EIGHT PERMS FOR A DIGITAL AGE*, Dauerwelle Ship, Bremen, Germany  
* **2022** – *Gedankenexperimente*, Galerie Flut, Hochschule für Künste Bremen, Germany  
* **2023** – *Propaganda Narrative Soundscapes*, *Edit Wars* project, Tor40 gallery, Bremen, Germany  
* **2023** – *Arche-Scriptures*, Ars Electronica Festival, HfK Bremen student exhibition *Matter Matters* ([link](https://ars.electronica.art/who-owns-the-truth/en/arche-scriptures/))  
* **2023** – *Arche-Scriptures: Reflection Between Earth and Sky*, Voltaje Festival, Bogotá, Colombia ([link](https://voltaje.co/team-member/alberto-harres/))  
* **2024** – *Studies of Change*, Alte Pathologie, Bremen, Germany ([link](https://studiesofchange.hfk-bremen.de/))  
* **2024** – Solo exhibition *Terra Inscrita: Reflexões sobre a Bacia do Rio Cuiabá*, Galeria Estação Jaqueira, Petrópolis, Brazil ([link](https://tribunadepetropolis.com.br/noticias/agenda-do-fim-de-semana-conta-com-diversos-eventos-literarios-e-muitas-outras-atracoes-gratuitas-em-petropolis-saiba-mais/))  
* **2024** – *Arche-Scriptures: Border lines*, PixxelPoint Festival, Carinarnica ([link](https://www.pixxelpoint.org/arche-scriptures/))  
* **2024** – Master Thesis Exhibition *Terra Inscrita: Topographic Scars \ Sedimenting Memories*, Bremen, Germany  
* **2025** – *AdNauseam*, exhibition *Choose your filter!*, ZKM | Center for Art and Media, Karlsruhe, Germany  
* **2025** – *Terra Inscrita: Topographic Scars \ Sedimenting Memories*, BBK Jahresausstellung 2025 – *Fließender Übergang*  
* **2025** – Solo exhibition, Generative Arts Fair (*Adela Festival*), Ljudmila Lab, Ljubljana, Slovenia  

### Professional Experience

* **2016–2017** – Internship at *SuperUber*, developing interactive video installations for museums and events (OpenFrameworks, C++)  
* **2017–2018** – Junior Fullstack Developer, Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV), developing internal tools for educational programs  
* **2018–2019** – Front-end Developer, *Superviz*, online VR collaborative platform (interface development and long-term strategy)  
* **2019–2020** – Lead Creative Developer, *Venosa Design*, developing interactive experiences  
* **2021–present** – Lead Software Developer & Researcher (Independent Contractor), Cornell Tech University, *AdNauseam* and *TrackMeNot* web extensions (Daniel Howe & Helen Nissenbaum)  
* **2022–2023** – Web Developer & Data Analyst, *EditWars* project ([editwars.org](https://editwars.org))  
* **2023–present** – Freelance Developer, *InfraNodus* ([infranodus.com](https://infranodus.com/))  

### Workshops / Talks

* **2013** – *Glitch* workshop with Caio Chacal, NANO Lab, UFRJ, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2017** – Assistant for Carlos Oliveira, Processing programming course, Istituto Europeo di Design, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2022** – Organizer, *Digital Media Juicy Workshops*; facilitator of *API & Databases in the Artistic Context using Node.js*, Hochschule für Künste Bremen ([link](https://www.hfk-bremen.de/node/37888))  
* **2023** – *Introduction to Web Development* workshop, Digital Media Master Program, HfK Bremen (HTML, JavaScript, CSS, GitHub Pages)  
* **2025** – Talk at *Clay+nology* event, BIO-TECHNO Lab (with Olesya Ilenok), Glasgow, Scotland  

### Projects and Grants

* **2016–2017** – Research & technical assistant, *Art, History and the Museum in Process*, led by Prof. Beatriz Pimenta, UFRJ, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil  
* **2022–2023** – *Edit Wars Project* – EU Horizon 2020 (MediaFutures «‎Artist for media»‎), with Antonio Ribeiro, Lucy Saribegyan, Maiia Guseva, Slava Romanov, Sofya Ozga  

### Awards

* **2019** – *Arte Eletrônica Indígena* – CyberArts 2019 Prix Ars Electronica – STARTS Prize ’19 · Honorary Mention (\[link, p.201])  
* **2022** – 1st Place, *Hochschulpreis Digitale Medien 2022*, HfK Bremen  
* **2022** – Best artistic project *Edit Wars*, Media Futures grant (team: Alberto Harres, Antonio Ribeiro, Lucy Saribegyan, Maiia Guseva, Slava Romanov, Sofya Ozga)  
* **2023** – 1st Place, *Interdisciplinary Hochschulpreis*, project *WeCookit and WeEatit* (collaborative student group)  
* **2025** – 1st Prize, *Parameter – Generative Arts Fair*, Adela Festival, Ljudmila Lab, Ljubljana, Slovenia

* **English** – Fluent (TOEFL 111/120)
